intro: Leucanthemum montanum subsp. delarbrei, commonly known as the Delarbre’s white ragwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant features a basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine meadows and dry grasslands. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
